definition: Hanseong, former name of Seoul (capital of South Korea), replaced in 2005 with 首爾|首尔[Shou3 er3]
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Hanseong Special Metropolitan City, old name for Seoul, capital of Korea

sentences.english: Kimfu is located west to Seoul .
1970 b . f . a applied arts seoul national university.
sentences.chinese: 1970年漢城國立大學，實用藝術，美術學士。

sentences.english: Kim originally majored in fashion design, graduating from Seoul National University.
sentences.chinese: 金原來是主修時裝設計的，畢業於漢城國立大學。

sentences.english: After the preview, an exhibition tour will be held in Seoul and some other cities.
sentences.chinese: 預展結束後將赴漢城等地進行巡迴展。

sentences.english: On the streets of Seoul, there was no sense of panic, but rather an undercurrent of anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 在漢城的街道，沒有恐慌感，而是一種焦慮的暗流。

sentences.english: They met in a movie studio in Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 他們是在漢城一家電影製作室見的面。

sentences.english: A city of southwest South Korea south-southeast of Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 光州韓國西南部一城市，位於漢城東南偏南。

sentences.english: Incognito plays "Nights Over Egypt" live in Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 微服私訪次在埃及居住在漢城的夜。

sentences.english: In the first days of nineteen-fifty-one, the North Koreans recaptured Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 在十九五十一的第一天，朝鮮收復漢城。

sentences.english: Our city is twinned with Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 本市與漢城結成姊妹市。

sentences.english: Jonghyun received surgery on his left leg at a hospital in Seoul on January 17th.
sentences.chinese: 鍾鉉在漢城接受左腳手術在1月17日在醫院。

sentences.english: Everland dis a Theme parks in the outskirts of Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 愛寶樂園是一個位於在漢城郊外的主題公園。

sentences.english: They re-organized and, two months later, re-gained control of Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 他們重新組織，兩個月後，重新獲得控制漢城。

definition: to shut down/to terminate/to cancel/to go out of business
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Ministry of Railways (MOR), disbanded in 2013 with its regulatory functions taken over by the Ministry of Transport 交通運輸部|交通运输部[Jiao1 tong1 Yun4 shu1 bu4]
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
geographical area of command/(PLA) military district
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
